conclusion: Determine acceleration of the two-body system before the string breaks.
For A: m g - T = m a; For B: T - m g sin θ = m a; Add equations to find a = g(1 - sin θ)/2.
Use sin 37° ≈ 0.6 and g = 10 m/s².
Calculate a = 10(1 - 0.6)/2 = 2 m/s².
Determine speed of the blocks when A has descended 1 m.
Calculate v² = 2 a s = 4, thus v = 2 m/s.
Note time for this part is t₀ = √(2s/a) = 1 s.
At this instant B is 1 m up the incline and moving upward at 2 m/s.
Conditions just after the string breaks.
For B, the only force is m g sin θ downward; calculate a₁ = -g sin θ = -6 m/s².
Initial velocity v₀ = +2 m/s up the plane; Initial position s = 0 at break point.
Determine how far and how long B continues to climb.
Set v = 0 for highest point; calculate t_up = -v₀/a₁ = 1/3 s.
Calculate s_up = v₀ t_up + ½ a₁ t_up² = 1/3 m.
B rises an additional 1/3 m beyond the break point.
Descent back to the bottom of the incline.
Calculate total distance s_down = 4/3 m.
Calculate t_down² = 2 s_down/a = 4/9; thus t_down = 2/3 s.
Total time after the break.
Calculate t_total = t_up + t_down = 1 s.
Final answer: After the string breaks, object B needs 1 s to slide back down to the bottom of the inclined plane.
